alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Henderson; McDonough; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 12:31AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Warren, Henderson, northern McDonough, northern Hancock, southwestern Des Moines and central Lee Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1231 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Roseville to near Niota. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Roseville around 1235 AM CDT. La Harpe, Terre Haute and Disco around 1250 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Blandinsville, Raritan, Sciota, Good Hope, Bushnell and Little Swan Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Illinois...and southeastern Iowa.
